page.title: 14NATURE CONSERVATION-PADBURY
page.content: There are differing attitudes to conservation within the village. Some farmers are pulling up hedges, but most are leaving them and many are planting trees.Some farmers are care- less when stubble burning, but the majority take care and follow the rules laid down by their union. There has been local controversy recently when the water authority decided to clean up the river during early summer, thus destroying the nests of some water birds though some were saved by the efforts of a handful of villagers. The now disused railway line which passes through the area is a haven for many species of flora and fauna. Here if you are lucky you may see a fox or a green woodpecker, a rabbit or a tree creeper. If you know where to look you may see wild violets, primroses or cowslips.
